snippet: Fewer T.S.A. screeners, tighter budgets, new checkpoint procedures and growing numbers of passengers have led to epic security lines, and there’s no end in sight.
abstract: Airlines and airports officials warn that wait times for security lines at airports could reach epidemic levels over summer and advise passengers to arrive at least two hours prior to departure; trend is due to increase in number of travelers, combined with updated checkpoint procedures and tighter Transportation Security Administration budget that has forced agency to cut down on number of screeners.
lead_paragraph: Fewer T.S.A. screeners, tighter budgets, new checkpoint procedures and growing numbers of passengers have led to epic security lines, and there’s no end in sight.

headline.print_headline: Summer Havoc  Feared as Lines Snarl Airports
headline.main: Catching a Flight? Budget Hours, Not Minutes, for Security
